intro: Cynomorium philippense, commonly known as the Philippine horned cucumber, is a climbing plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes other cucurbits like squash and melons. The plant features tendrils that help it climb and has large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals, and it produces fruits that are elongated and covered in spines. The botanical characteristics of Cynomorium philippense make it distinct within its family, though it is less commonly cultivated than other cucurbits.
